ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned so much about how to understand poetry and the motivation behind poetry - how the form of the work affects the work itself.
Amazing course where I learned deep reading of poetry and thematic analysis.
better poetry analysis toolkit, better understanding of major poetic works, and again, just a wonderful seminar so I got better at speaking & writing about the texts we read.

I learned so much about interpreting works of poetry / text- the discussion nature of the class made it so that I was constantly imagining new possibilities within the work we read... I would often leave class, full of beautiful and new ideas that I had never considered before.
How to think about human nature
A wide-ranging reading in poems about vision, spanning centuries and approaching both the Western and Eastern traditions.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course really allows for thorough exploration of each work and a lot of flexibility to explore other topics.
Highly interesting schedule and reading material. I think its very well planned and the materials are thematically connected throughout the course

strengths: Riley Soles - he is a fantastic professor who is genuinely so passionate about the works, hearing what students have to say, and generally being a great support system. Really interesting poetry from both East & West. Weaknesses: felt like we read a lot of poems to only discuss a few, but the poems were good so still personally fulfilling

Strengths are that the works of poetry and literature that we read, were exceptionally well-suited for discussion. They raised so many possibilities and the discussion was never boring, flat, or without depth.

I thought it was a very good course! I greatly enjoyed the readings and looked forward to class discussions, which were always fascinating and engaging. My only note for improvement might be to change the amount of reading we had each week and/or how it was approached during class-time, as we often looked so closely at certain poems and did not have time to cover everything we had read.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. Great class because Professor Soles shows passion for and understanding of the course material. Also very interesting for students interested in poetry that challenges the ordinary.
Yes! Riley is an amazing professor and if you try to engage with the work a little bit, the papers can actually be really interesting and fun to write

I would definitely recommend this course. The professor is one of the most incredible teachers I've ever got to learn from. He is so passionate about the material, and is able to communicate this passion in such an exceptional manner, that you cannot help but feel inspired yourself. The class discussions are so vibrant and the course reading is just so wonderfully chosen as well.
A fascinating course with some great readings and interesting ideas to think about. Professor Soles is very passionate and the class discussions were always fun. Take it if the subject interests you!
